column2: design.assignment <- model.matrix(~ -1+factor(GSE27973.qc.rma$treatment)) #tells us where the cases and controls are located in the df
#Fit a linear model, according to limma package implementation, to expression data using design matrix model
#Get the contrasts for samples of interest
#Adjust fit coefficients using an empirical Bayes moderation of standard errors
fit2.assignment <- eBayes(fit2.assignment) #additional bayes correction step... required step!
#Results for each hypothesis test can be extracted using

assignment_results <- topTable(fit2.assignment, coef="treatment", adjust="BH", num=200) #BH takes into account ALL of the comparisons that are being made... the 'num=200' is simply calling r to show the top 200 results
